sen.j: 三好 之長（みよし ゆきなが）は、戦国時代 (日本)の武将。
sen.e: Yukinaga MIYOSHI was a Busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period (period of warring states).
Yukinaga MIYOSHI was a Busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period (period of warring states).
Yukinaga MIYOSHI was a Busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period (period of warring states).

sen.j: 本姓は源氏。
sen.e: His real family name was Genji.
His real family name was the Minamoto clan.
His real family name was the Minamoto clan.

sen.j: 家系は清和源氏の一家系・河内源氏の傍系・甲斐源氏の流れを汲む小笠原氏の庶家にあたる。
sen.e: His family line was a branch family of the Ogasawara clandescended from the Kai-Genji (Minamoto clan), collateral line of Kawachi-Genji which was a family of the Seiwa-Genji Clan.
His family line was a branch family of the Ogasawara clandescended from the Kai-Genji (Minamoto clan), collateral line of Kawachi-Genji which was a family of the Seiwa-Genji.
His family line was a branch family of the Ogasawara clandescended from the Kai-Genji (Minamoto clan), collateral line of Kawachi-Genji which was a family of the Seiwa-Genji.

sen.j: 諱の之長は、阿波国の守護・細川成之の偏諱を受けたものである。
sen.e: As for his Imina (personal name), Yukinaga, he was granted to use a portion of the real name of Shigeyuki HOSOKAWA, Shugo (a provincial military governor) of Awa Province.
As for his Imina (personal name), Yukinaga, he was granted to use a portion of the real name of Shigeyuki HOSOKAWA, Shugo (a provincial military governor) of Awa Province.
As for his Imina (personal name), Yukinaga, he was granted to use a portion of the real name of Shigeyuki HOSOKAWA, Shugo (a provincial military governor) of Awa Province.

tit.cmt: 頭文字を大文字に変更

sen.j: 室町幕府の管領を代々務めた名族細川氏の家臣。
sen.e: His family line was one of the retainers of the Hosokawa clan, a noble family which filled the post of Kanrei (shogunal deputy) of the Muromachi Bakufu for generations.

His family line was one of the retainers of the Hosokawa clan, a noble family which filled the post of Kanrei (shogunal deputy) of the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) for generations.

His family line was one of the retainers of the Hosokawa clan, a noble family which filled the post of Kanrei (shogunal deputy) of the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) for generations.

sen.j: 父は三好長之。
sen.e: His father was Yukinaga MIYOSHI.
sen.cmt: 「三好長之」は、用語集からそのまま引用いたしましたが、「Nagayuki」と読むのが普通で、セル2のoriginalおよびtrans 1から察するに、「Yukinaga」は間違いと思います。
sen.e: His father was Nagayuki MIYOSHI.
His father was Nagayuki MIYOSHI.

sen.j: 子に三好長秀。
sen.e: His children included Nagahide MIYOSHI.
His children included Nagahide MIYOSHI.
His children included Nagahide MIYOSHI.

sen.j: 一説に長秀の子・三好元長も之長の子とされる。
sen.e: Some people say that Motonaga MIYOSHI, a child of Nagahide was also a child of Yukinaga.
Some people say that Motonaga MIYOSHI, a child of Nagahide was also a child of Yukinaga.
Some people say that Motonaga MIYOSHI, a child of Nagahide was also a child of Yukinaga.

sen.j: 三好長慶の曽祖父（または祖父）にあたり、三好氏が畿内に進出するきっかけを作り出した名将である。
sen.e: He was the great-grandfather (or grandfather) of Nagayoshi MIYOSHI and a great commander who seized an opportunity for the Miyoshi clan to make inroads into Kinai region (provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara).

He was the great-grandfather (or grandfather) of Nagayoshi MIYOSHI and a great commander who seized an opportunity for the Miyoshi clan to make inroads into Kinai region (provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara).

He was the great-grandfather (or grandfather) of Nagayoshi MIYOSHI and a great commander who seized an opportunity for the Miyoshi clan to make inroads into Kinai region (provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara).

sen.j: 長禄2年（1458年）、三好長之の子として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in 1458 as a child of Nagayuki MIYOSHI.
He was born in 1458 as a child of Nagayuki MIYOSHI.
He was born in 1458 as a child of Nagayuki MIYOSHI.

sen.j: 細川氏の家臣として仕え、応仁の乱で初陣を飾り、以来、数多くの戦いに参加している。
sen.e: He served the Hosokawa clan as a retainer and went on his first campaign in the Onin War and since than participated in many battles.
He served the Hosokawa clan as a retainer and went on his first campaign in the Onin War and since then participated in many battles.
He served the Hosokawa clan as a retainer and went on his first campaign in the Onin War and since then participated in many battles.

sen.j: 細川氏の全盛期を築いた細川政元の後継者問題においては養子の細川澄元を支持した。
sen.e: In the issue of a successor to Masamoto HOSOKAWA who produced the golden days of the Hosokawa clan, he supported Sumimoto HOSOKAWA, a adopted child.
In the issue of a successor to Masamoto HOSOKAWA who produced the golden days of the Hosokawa clan, he supported Sumimoto HOSOKAWA, an adopted child of Masamoto.
sen.cmt: a adopted child→an adopted child of Masamotoに修正
sen.e: In the issue of a successor to Masamoto HOSOKAWA who produced the golden days of the Hosokawa clan, he supported Sumimoto HOSOKAWA, an adopted child of Masamoto.

sen.j: 政元が細川澄之派の重臣によって暗殺されると、澄之を打倒し、澄元と共に将軍・足利義澄を擁立して権勢を掌握した。
sen.e: After Masamoto was assassinated by a chief retainer of the Sumiyuki HOSOKAWA group, he overthrew Sumiyuki and came into power by backing up Shogun Yoshizumi ASHIKAGA with Sumimoto.
After Masamoto was assassinated by a chief retainer of the Sumiyuki HOSOKAWA group, he overthrew Sumiyuki and came into power by backing up Shogun Yoshizumi ASHIKAGA with Sumimoto.
After Masamoto was assassinated by a chief retainer of the Sumiyuki HOSOKAWA group, he overthrew Sumiyuki and came into power by backing up Shogun Yoshizumi ASHIKAGA with Sumimoto.

sen.j: しかし政元のもう一人の養子である細川高国や大内義興との権力争いに敗れ、阿波国に逃亡することを余儀なくされている。
sen.e: However, he was defeated in a power struggle with Takakuni HOSOKAWA, another adopted child of Masamoto and Yoshioki OUCHI and was forced to escape to Awa Province.
However, he was defeated in a power struggle with Takakuni HOSOKAWA, another adopted child of Masamoto and Yoshioki OUCHI and was forced to escape to Awa Province.
However, he was defeated in a power struggle with Takakuni HOSOKAWA, another adopted child of Masamoto and Yoshioki OUCHI and was forced to escape to Awa Province.

sen.j: 永正6年（1509年）から高国・義興と戦って京都奪還を目指したが敗れ（如意ケ嶽の戦い）、子の三好長秀を失った。
sen.e: Although he fought against Takakuni and Yoshioki from 1509 to recover Kyoto, he was defeated (Battle of Nyoigatake) and lost his son, Nagahide MIYOSHI.
Although he fought against Takakuni and Yoshioki from 1509 to recover Kyoto, he was defeated (Battle of Nyoigatake) and lost his son, Nagahide MIYOSHI.
Although he fought against Takakuni and Yoshioki from 1509 to recover Kyoto, he was defeated (Battle of Nyoigatake) and lost his son, Nagahide MIYOSHI.

sen.j: 永正8年（1511年）、高国・義興と決戦を挑んだが、敗れて阿波国に撤退した（船岡山の戦い）。
sen.e: In 1511, although he challenged Takakuni and Yoshioki to a decisive fight, he was defeated and withdrew to Awa Province (the Battle of Funaokayama).
In 1511, although he challenged Takakuni and Yoshioki to a decisive fight, he was defeated and withdrew to Awa Province (the Battle of Funaokayama).
In 1511, although he challenged Takakuni and Yoshioki to a decisive fight, he was defeated and withdrew to Awa Province (the Battle of Funaokayama).

sen.j: 永正15年（1518年）、大内義興が周防に帰国したのを見て、永正16年（1519年）10月から摂津国の国人を扇動して高国軍を破った。
sen.e: After he saw Yoshioki OUCHI having returned to Suo Province in 1518, he stirred up Kokujin (local samurai) of Settsu Province from November 1519 to defeat the Takakuni's army.
sen.cmt: 「永正16年10月」＝グレゴリオ暦「西暦1519年11月3日 」、出典：http://maechan.net/kanreki
sen.e: After he saw Yoshioki OUCHI having returned to Suo Province in 1518, he stirred up Kokujin (local samurai) of Settsu Province from November 1519 to defeat the Takakuni's army.
After he saw Yoshioki OUCHI having returned to Suo Province in 1518, he stirred up Kokujin (local samurai) of Settsu Province from November 1519 to defeat the Takakuni's army.

sen.j: さらに永正17年（1520年）1月には山城で土一揆によって生じた洛中の混乱に乗じて高国を追放し、一時、京の制圧に成功した。
sen.e: Further, in January 1520, taking advantage of the confusion in Kyoto caused by a peasants' uprising in Yamashiro Province, he banished Takakuni and succeeded in gaining control of Kyoto, though temporarily.
sen.cmt: 「永正17年1月」＝グレゴリオ暦「西暦1520年1月31日 」、出典：http://maechan.net/kanreki
sen.e: Further, in January 1520, taking advantage of the confusion in Kyoto caused by a peasants' uprising in Yamashiro Province, he banished Takakuni and succeeded in gaining control of Kyoto, though temporarily.

Further, in January 1520, taking advantage of the confusion in Kyoto caused by a peasants' uprising in Yamashiro Province, he banished Takakuni and succeeded in gaining control of Kyoto, though temporarily.

sen.j: しかし5月、体制を立て直した高国の反撃に遭い、京都等持院で戦った。
sen.e: In May, however, he was counterattacked by Takakuni who rearranged his troops and fought in Kyoto Jito-In.
sen.cmt: 「一原文一訳文の例外対処」「京都等持院」は、用語集に「Kyoto Jito-In」とあり、そのまま引用いたしましたが、同じく用語集に「等持院」＝「Tojiin Temple」とあり、「Tojiin」が正しいと思います。
sen.e: In May, however, he was counterattacked by Takakuni who rearranged his troops and fought at Toji-in Temple in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: in Kyoto Jito-In→at Toji-in Temple in Kyotoに修正
sen.e: In May, however, he was counterattacked by Takakuni who rearranged his troops and fought at Toji-in Temple in Kyoto.

sen.j: 多勢に無勢のため敗れ、捕らえられた。
sen.e: Since his troops were outnumbered, he was defeated and captured.
Since his troops were outnumbered, he was defeated and captured.
Since his troops were outnumbered, he was defeated and captured.

sen.j: そして5月11日、知恩寺において斬首された。
sen.e: And, on June 6, 1520, he was decapitated at Chion-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 「永正17年5月11日」＝グレゴリオ暦「西暦1520年6月6日 」、出典：http://maechan.net/kanreki
sen.e: And, on June 6, 1520, he was decapitated at Chion-ji Temple.
And, on June 6, 1520, he was decapitated at Chion-ji Temple.

sen.j: 享年63。
sen.e: He died at 63.
He died at the age of 63.
sen.cmt: at→at the age ofとしました。
sen.e: He died at the age of 63.

sen.j: 之長の2人の子息も、翌日に死罪に処された。
sen.e: Yukinaga's two sons were also executed on the following day.
Yukinaga's two sons were also executed on the following day.
Yukinaga's two sons were also executed on the following day.

tit.cmt: 頭文字を大文字に変更

sen.j: 等持院の戦いで逃走しているとき、肥満してたため逃げ切れず捕らえられたという。
sen.e: It is said that, when he was running away during the battle of Tojiin, he was unable to escape and captured due to his obese body.
It is said that, when he was running away during the Battle of Toji-in Temple, he was unable to escape and captured due to his obese body.
sen.cmt: the Battle of Toji-in Templeとしました。
sen.e: It is said that, when he was running away during the Battle of Toji-in Temple, he was unable to escape and captured due to his obese body.

sen.j: 高国は之長を用いようとしたが、かつて之長が殺した細川尚春の遺族が処刑を要求したため、高国も思い直したとされる。
sen.e: It is understood that Takakuni intended to employ him, but the bereaved family of Hisaharu HOSOKAWA who had been killed by Yukinaga required his execution, and so Takakuni reconsidered.
It is understood that Takakuni intended to employ him, but the bereaved family of Hisaharu HOSOKAWA who had been killed by Yukinaga required his execution, and so Takakuni reconsidered.
It is understood that Takakuni intended to employ him, but the bereaved family of Hisaharu HOSOKAWA who had been killed by Yukinaga required his execution, and so Takakuni reconsidered.

sen.j: ちなみに之長が処刑された5月11日は、前年に之長が尚春を殺した日であった。
sen.e: Incidentally, the day, June 6 (lunar calendar: May 11) on which Yukinaga was executed falls on the same day (lunar calendar: May 11) on which Yukinaga had killed Hisaharu in the previous year.
sen.cmt: 「前年」の「5月11日」を検索しますと、下記のとおり「6月18日」となります。セル34の「6月6日」と合致いたしませんので、この文章では、「(lunar calendar: May 11)」を記入いたしました。 「永正16年5月11日」＝グレゴリオ暦「西暦1519年6月18日 」、出典：http://maechan.net/kanreki
sen.e: Incidentally, the day, June 6 (lunar calendar: May 11) on which Yukinaga was executed falls on the same day (lunar calendar: May 11) on which Yukinaga had killed Hisaharu in the previous year.
Incidentally, the day, June 6 (lunar calendar: May 11) on which Yukinaga was executed falls on the same day (lunar calendar: May 11) on which Yukinaga had killed Hisaharu in the previous year.

sen.j: 之長は名将だったが横暴な一面があったために人望が無かった。
sen.e: Although Yukinaga was a great commander, he was unpopular due to his character of high-handed aspect.
Although Yukinaga was a great commander, he was unpopular due to his character of high-handed aspect.
Although Yukinaga was a great commander, he was unpopular due to his character of high-handed aspect.

sen.j: 処刑されたとき、聾盲記において以下のように記されている。
sen.e: When he was executed, Romoki described that 'Although Miyoshi is very strong in the battles, the vengeance of Heaven has come down on him like this.
When he was executed, Romoki described as follows.
sen.cmt: 「一原文一訳文の例外対処」仕様書に基づき原文を分割しました。文末にas follows追加
sen.e: When he was executed, Romoki described as follows.

sen.j: 「合戦には三好と申して大強のものなれども、天罰にてかくのごとし。」
sen.e: Although Miyoshi is very strong in the battles, the vengeance of Heaven has come down on him like this.'
sen.cmt: 「一原文一訳文の例外対処」クォーテーション追加
sen.e: Although Miyoshi is very strong in the battles, the vengeance of Heaven has come down on him like this.'

sen.j: 「一時に滅するなり……いまの三好は、大悪の大出（最高）なるものなり。」
sen.e: He has perished all at once and Miyoshi is now a thoroughly most wicked person.
He has perished all at once and Miyoshi is now a thoroughly most wicked person.'
sen.cmt: 「一原文一訳文の例外対処」クォーテーション追加
sen.e: He has perished all at once and Miyoshi is now a thoroughly most wicked person.'

sen.j: 「皆の人々悦喜せざるはなし」
sen.e: All the people is now full of joy.'
All the people is now full of joy.'
sen.cmt: 「一原文一訳文の例外対処」クォーテーション追加
sen.e: All the people is now full of joy.'

sen.j: 無念の最期を遂げた之長だが、彼の畿内進出は、のちの元長・長慶らによって覇権奪取・三好家の全盛期を築き上げる基礎となった。
sen.e: Although Yukinaga died a regrettable death, his inroads into Kinai region formed the foundation of capturing power by Motonaga and Nagayoshi afterward and establishing the golden days of Miyoshi clan.

Although Yukinaga died a regrettable death, his inroads into Kinai region formed the foundation of capturing power by Motonaga and Nagayoshi afterward and establishing the golden days of Miyoshi clan.

Although Yukinaga died a regrettable death, his inroads into Kinai region formed the foundation of capturing power by Motonaga and Nagayoshi afterward and establishing the golden days of Miyoshi clan.
